text: My Chemical Romance kicked off their â€œLong Live: The Black Parade North American Tourâ€ at T-Mobile Park in Seattle, Washington on Friday (July 11th). The 11-date run, which is completely sold out after moving an impressive 350,000 tickets, features the band performing their beloved 2006 album The Black Parade in full at each stop. Get My Chemical Romance Tickets Here To start the show, MCR took the stage in updated versions of their signature marching band uniforms from The Black Parade era. They played the album front-to-back, reworking several songs with new, expanded arrangements. Among the reimagined tracks was â€œMama,â€ with a newly added â€œdaggerâ€ outro that the band had previewed on social media earlier in the week. Kayleigh Goldsworthy joined the band on violin for both â€œCancerâ€ and â€œMama,â€ and several tracks, including â€œSleep,â€ featured extended new intros and outros. Following the full-album performance, the band returned for a B-stage encore filled with fan favorites and deep cuts, including â€œIâ€™m Not Okay (I Promise),â€ â€œHeaven Help Us,â€ â€œBury Me in Black,â€ and â€œHelena.â€ The night also featured a haunting instrumental performance by cellist Clarice Jensen, who opened the encore with an atmospheric piece incorporating snippets of â€œAn Offering.â€ The night also featured several highly theatrical moments involving frontman Gerard Way and the band, including holding a mock election in which audience members voted whether to â€œexecuteâ€ four people by firing squad. At another point, Way was kidnapped by a clown. Fans have already begun to unpack the showâ€™s undertones, with some interpreting the election sequence, for example, as a metaphor for the illusion of democracy. Check out fan-capture footage of the concert, as well as the full setlist, below. Fans can look for tickets to MCRâ€™s sold-out Black Parade concerts here. html:
My Chemical Romance kicked off their â€œLong Live: The Black Parade North American Tourâ€ at T-Mobile Park in Seattle, Washington on Friday (July 11th). The 11-date run, which is completely sold out after moving an impressive 350,000 tickets, features the band performing their beloved 2006 album The Black Parade in full at each stop.

Get My Chemical Romance Tickets Here

To start the show, MCR took the stage in updated versions of their signature marching band uniforms from The Black Parade era. They played the album front-to-back, reworking several songs with new, expanded arrangements. Among the reimagined tracks was â€œMama,â€ with a newly added â€œdaggerâ€ outro that the band had previewed on social media earlier in the week. Kayleigh Goldsworthy joined the band on violin for both â€œCancerâ€ and â€œMama,â€ and several tracks, including â€œSleep,â€ featured extended new intros and outros.

Following the full-album performance, the band returned for a B-stage encore filled with fan favorites and deep cuts, including â€œIâ€™m Not Okay (I Promise),â€ â€œHeaven Help Us,â€ â€œBury Me in Black,â€ and â€œHelena.â€ The night also featured a haunting instrumental performance by cellist Clarice Jensen, who opened the encore with an atmospheric piece incorporating snippets of â€œAn Offering.â€

The night also featured several highly theatrical moments involving frontman Gerard Way and the band, including holding a mock election in which audience members voted whether to â€œexecuteâ€ four people by firing squad. At another point, Way was kidnapped by a clown. Fans have already begun to unpack the showâ€™s undertones, with some interpreting the election sequence, for example, as a metaphor for the illusion of democracy.

Check out fan-capture footage of the concert, as well as the full setlist, below. Fans can look for tickets to MCRâ€™s sold-out Black Parade concerts here.
